Class ShapeTool

Direct Known Subclasses:
AnySidedPolygonTool, DrawLineTool, EllipseTool, LineTool, PolygonTool, RectangleTool, RectangularCreationTool
public abstract class ShapeTool
extends ConstructionTool

This provides basic functionality for a tool used to create concrete Figures. Concrete subclasses must provide, at a minimum: newShape(int,int) But may also wish to consider mouseDragged(MouseEvent) or other events that dynamically alter/build the Figure.

Method Detail

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Called if the mouse is pressed. By default, create a new figure and add it. Keep track of where the mouse went down for future operations in addition to standard creation of new shape if we are not in the midst of constructing one. Consume the event since we handle it.
Overrides:
mousePressed in class ConstructionTool
Parameters:
e - the event

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Called if the mouse is released. By default, if the mouse went up the same place it went down, remove the figure as it is probably bogus. In addition, call the superclass to get inherited behavior.
Overrides:
mouseReleased in class ConstructionTool
Parameters:
e - the event
